message: Just wanted you to know I've updated jQuery to 1.5.2
We don't use it that much, but still, it's better to have a newer version. If nothing else, it should be a little faster
sure, that was a needed change
not sure about the CDN thing though, I like having it locally. Makes offline coding easier.
I can revert it to a local copy if you'd like, but almost all of jquery code is tied to google maps, and if you're offline, you can't see them either
Mm, -0 on the CDN, though I appreciate the site's not so useful without Google maps :)
maybe my class-based-views should be merged periodically, since I add tests before re-implementing each views as a class-based one
that's cool, but we need to make sure there's no overlap
No problem, I'll add a local version then :)
After that, I guess I'll start writing tests
and I think @danfairs made some testing-related changes in his geodjango branch
Just so you know, I updated the md5/hashlib and template loaders and I'm currently working on csrf protection
@brutasse Yes - though I've been merging your CBV branch to make sure your changes come across cleanly.
I'm more or less done with updating CSRF protection, I'll check the code one more time and send a pull request tomorrow.
